poem:
### Algorithmic Rides

In the honk  
and weave of city pulse,  
codes unseen  
tangle dollars away.  
Drivers afloat  
on promises, passengers  
drift in calculated currents.  
Each fare a silent  
cymbal - the digital  
orchestra, strumming  
profit's veiled tune.  
Wheels turn,  
misaligned to the heartbeat  
of labor's soft cry.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Second study finds Uber used opaque algorithm to dramatically boost profits A second major academic institution has accused Uber of using opaque computer code to dramatically increase its profits at the expense of the ride-hailing app’s drivers and passengers. Research by academics at New York’s Columbia Business School concluded that the Silicon Valley company had implemented “algorithmic price discrimination” that had raised “rider fares and cut driver pay on billions of … trips, systematically, selectively,". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
